body_html:
Ah, I didn't think you could broadcast over dimensions of size != 1.
…
On Wed, Sep 5, 2018 at 4:17 PM Yan Facai (颜发才) ***@***.***> wrote: If I understand it correctly, tf.reduce_sum(grad, axis=0) results in [4, 3], rather than [2, 3]. Note that the second dimension is also broadcasted in the case. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. -- - Alex

body:
Ah, I didn't think you could broadcast over dimensions of size != 1.

On Wed, Sep 5, 2018 at 4:17 PM Yan Facai (颜发才) <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> If I understand it correctly, tf.reduce_sum(grad, axis=0) results in [4,
> 3], rather than [2, 3]. Note that the second dimension is also broadcasted
> in the case.
>
> —
